meanings.sent1: The doctor will reinoculate the patient to ensure continued protection.
meanings.sent2: After a few months, the vaccine may need to be reinoculated for maximum effectiveness.
meanings.sent3: The teddy bear decided to reinoculate all his stuffed animal friends to keep them healthy.
meanings.sent4: The idea of reinoculating the garden with fresh seeds sparked new growth and vitality.
meanings.sent5: The scientist reinoculated the petri dish to observe the effects of the new bacteria.

meanings.definition: To administer a vaccine or other substance to someone who has already been inoculated.
meanings.sent1: It is important to reinoculate individuals who may have missed their initial vaccination.
meanings.sent2: The nurse will reinoculate the children before they start school to prevent any outbreaks.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved reinoculating the volunteer with disappearing ink.
meanings.sent4: The coach decided to reinoculate the team with motivation to boost their performance.
meanings.sent5: The chef reinoculated the dish with extra flavor to make it more appetizing.
